channel.description: Recent content on Australian school maths

item.description:
Logarithms and Exponentials #



Formulas #


$\log_a{(xy)} = \log_a{x} + log_a{y}$
$\log_a{\left(\dfrac{x}{y}\right)} = \log_a{x} - log_a{y}$
$\log_a{x^n} = n\log_a{x}$
$\log_a{\left(\dfrac{1}{x}\right)} = -\log_a{x}$
$\log_a{x} = \dfrac{\log_b{x}}{\log_b{a}}$

Working with Functions #



Formulas #


$a^m \times a^n = a^{m+n}$
$a^m \div a^n = \dfrac{a^m}{a^n} = a^{m-n}$
$(a^m)^n = a^{m \times n}$
$(ab)^n = a^nb^n$
$\left(\dfrac{a}{b}\right)^n = \dfrac{a^n}{b^n}$
$a^0=1$
$a^{-n}=\dfrac{1}{a^n}$
$\left(\dfrac{a}{b}\right)^{-n} = \left(\dfrac{b}{a}\right)^n$
$a^{\frac{m}{n}} =\sqrt[n]{a^m}$
$ \sqrt{xy} = \sqrt{x} \times \sqrt{y} $
$ \sqrt{\dfrac{x}{y}} = \dfrac{\sqrt{x}}{\sqrt{y}} $
$ (\sqrt{x})^2 = \sqrt{x^2} = x \text{ for } x\ge 0 $

Further Work with Functions #


Polynomials #


Graphing Techniques #

Modelling Financial Situations #



Formulas #


$A = P(1+r)^n$
$ T_n = T_{n-1} + d $
$T_n = a + (n-1)d$
$S_n = \dfrac{n}{2}[2a + (n-1)d] = \dfrac{n}{2}(a+l)$
$T_n = rT_{n-1}$
$T_n = ar^{n-1}$
$S_n = \dfrac{a(1-r^n)}{1-r} = \dfrac{a(r^n-1)}{r-1},\ \ r \neq 1$
$S=\dfrac{a}{1-r},\ \ |r|<1$

Arithmetic vs geometric sequences #


  Arithmetic sequence Geometric sequence
Recursive definition $ T_n = T_{n-1} + d $ $T_n = rT_{n-1}$
n-th term $T_n = a + (n-1)d$ $T_n = ar^{n-1}$
Sum of first n terms $S_n = \dfrac{n}{2}[2a + (n-1)d] = \dfrac{n}{2}(a+l)$ $S_n = \dfrac{a(1-r^n)}{1-r} = \dfrac{a(r^n-1)}{r-1},\ \ r \neq 1$
Limiting sum $S=\dfrac{a}{1-r},\ \ |r|<1$

Proof by Mathematical Induction #

Introduction to Vectors #



Formulas #


$ \vec{AB} + \vec{BC} = \vec{AC} $
$ |\underset{\sim}{u}| = |x\underset{\sim}{i} + y\underset{\sim}{j}| = \sqrt{x^2+y^2} $
$ \underset{\sim}{a} + (-\underset{\sim}{a}) =0 $
$ \vec{AB} - \vec{AD} = \vec{AB} + \vec{DA} = \vec{DA} + \vec{AB} = \vec{DB} $
$ \text{The unit vector parallel to } \underset{\sim}{v} = \underset{\sim}{v} * \dfrac{1}{|\underset{\sim}{v}|} $
$\begin{pmatrix} a_1 \\b_1 \end{pmatrix} + \begin{pmatrix} a_2 \\b_2 \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} a_1 + a_2 \\b_1 + b_2 \end{pmatrix} $
$\begin{pmatrix} a_1 \\b_1 \end{pmatrix} - \begin{pmatrix} a_2 \\b_2 \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} a_1 - a_2 \\b_1 - b_2 \end{pmatrix} $
$\lambda \begin{pmatrix} a \\b \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} \lambda a \\ \lambda b \end{pmatrix}$
$|\underset{\sim}{u}| = \sqrt{x^2 + y^2}$
$|\vec{XY}| = \sqrt{(x_2-x_1)^2 + (y_2-y_1)^2}$
$\begin{pmatrix} a_1 \\b_1 \end{pmatrix} + \begin{pmatrix} a_2 \\b_2 \end{pmatrix} = (a_1 + a_2)\underset{\sim}{i} + (b_1+b_2)\underset{\sim}{j} $
$\begin{pmatrix} a_1 \\b_1 \end{pmatrix} - \begin{pmatrix} a_2 \\b_2 \end{pmatrix} = (a_1 - a_2)\underset{\sim}{i} + (b_1-b_2)\underset{\sim}{j} $
$\underset{\sim}{u}.\underset{\sim}{v} = |\underset{\sim}{u}||\underset{\sim}{v}|\cos\theta = x_1x_2 + y_1y_2 $
$\underset{\sim}{v}.\underset{\sim}{v} = |\underset{\sim}{v}|^2 $
$ \text{perpendicular vectors: }\underset{\sim}{u}.\underset{\sim}{v} = 0 $
$ \text{parallel vectors like directions: }\underset{\sim}{u}.\underset{\sim}{v} = |\underset{\sim}{u}||\underset{\sim}{v}| $
$ \text{parallel vectors unlike directions: }\underset{\sim}{u}.\underset{\sim}{v} = -|\underset{\sim}{u}||\underset{\sim}{v}| $
$ P_{\underset{\sim}{u}}\underset{\sim}{v} = \dfrac{\underset{\sim}{u}.\underset{\sim}{v}}{|\underset{\sim}{u}|^2} \underset{\sim}{u} $
$ \underset{\sim}{u} = (r\cos\theta, r\sin\theta) = r\cos\theta \underset{\sim}{i} + r\sin\theta \underset{\sim}{j} $
$ \underset{\sim}{v} = \int \underset{\sim}{a} \; dt$
$ \underset{\sim}{s} = \int \underset{\sim}{v} \; dt$
$\text{Initial velocity of a vector } = \underset{\sim}{v} = v\cos\theta \underset{\sim}{i} + v \sin \theta \underset{\sim}{j} \text{ where v is the initial speed, a scalar}$
$\text{acceleration due to gravity } = \underset{\sim}{a} = -g\underset{\sim}{j}$
Items on formula sheet are highlighted

Trigonometry and Measure of Angles #



Formulas #


$\sin A=\dfrac{opp}{hyp}$
$\cos A=\dfrac{adj}{hyp}$
$\tan A=\dfrac{opp}{adj}$
$\dfrac{a}{\sin A} = \dfrac{b}{\sin B} = \dfrac{c}{\sin C} $
$c^2 = a^2 + b^2 - 2ab \cos C$
$A = \dfrac{1}{2} ab \sin C$
$\sin (180^\circ - \theta) = \sin \theta $
$\cos (180 ^\circ - \theta) = - \cos \theta $
$\tan (180 ^\circ - \theta) = - \tan \theta $
$l=r\theta$
$A=\dfrac{1}{2}r^2 \theta$

Concepts #

Notes #

Reciprocal trigonometric functions Refer formulas below for cosececant (cosec or csc), secant(sec) and cotangent(cot).

Introduction to Differentiation #



Formulas #


$\text{gradient} = m = \dfrac{rise}{run} = \dfrac{y_2-y_1}{x_2-x_1}$
$ y=f(x) \,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\, \dfrac{dy}{dx} =\lim\limits_{h \to 0} \dfrac{f(x+h) - f(x)}{h} $
$ y=kx \,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\, \dfrac{dy}{dx} =k $
$ y=k \,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\, \dfrac{dy}{dx} =0 $
$ y=x^n \,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\, \dfrac{dy}{dx} =nx^{n-1} $
$ y=kx^n \,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\, \dfrac{dy}{dx} =knx^{n-1} $
$ y=kf(x) \,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\, \dfrac{dy}{dx} =kf'(x) $
$ y=f(x) + g(x) \,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\, \dfrac{dy}{dx} =f'(x) + g'(x) $
$y=f(x)^n \,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\, \dfrac{dy}{dx}=nf'(x)[f(x)]^{n-1}$
$y=uv \,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\, \dfrac{dy}{dx} = u\dfrac{dv}{dx} + v\dfrac{du}{dx}$
$y=\dfrac{u}{v} \,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\, \dfrac{dy}{dx} = \dfrac{v\dfrac{du}{dx} - u\dfrac{dv}{dx}}{v^2}$
$y=g(u) \text { where } u = f(x) \,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\, \dfrac{dy}{dx} = \dfrac{dy}{du} \times \dfrac{du}{dx} \text { (the chain rule)}$
Items on formula sheet are highlighted

$y=g(u) \text { where } u = f(x) \,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\, \dfrac{dy}{dx} = \dfrac{dy}{du} \times \dfrac{du}{dx} \text { (the chain rule)}$

Rates of Change #



Formulas #


$v = \dot x = \dfrac{dx}{dt}$
$a = \ddot x = \dfrac{dv}{dt} = \dfrac{d^{2}x}{dt^2}$
$\dfrac{dN}{dt} = kn \text{ is satisfied by } N(t) = Ae^{kt}$
$\dfrac{dN}{dt} = k(N-p) \text{ is satisfied by } N(t) = P + Ae^{kt}$
Items where proofs required are highlighted
$v = \dot x = \dfrac{dx}{dt}$
$a = \ddot x = \dfrac{dv}{dt} = \dfrac{d^{2}x}{dt^2}$
$\dfrac{dN}{dt} = kn \text{ is satisfied by } N(t) = Ae^{kt}$
$\dfrac{dN}{dt} = k(N-p) \text{ is satisfied by } N(t) = P + Ae^{kt}$

Differential Calculus #



Formulas #


$y=\sin (x) \,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\, \dfrac{dy}{dx} = \cos (x)$
$y=\cos (x) \,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\, \dfrac{dy}{dx} = -\sin (x)$
$y=a^x \,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\, \dfrac{dy}{dx} = (\ln a)a^x$
$y=\ln x \,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\, \dfrac{dy}{dx} = \dfrac{1}{x}$
$y=log_a {x} \,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\, \dfrac{dy}{dx} = \dfrac{1}{x \ln a}$
$y=\sin f(x) \,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\, \dfrac{dy}{dx} = f'(x)\cos f(x)$
$y=\cos f(x) \,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\, \dfrac{dy}{dx} = -f'(x)\sin f(x)$
$y=\tan f(x) \,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\, \dfrac{dy}{dx} = f'(x)\sec^2 f(x)$
$y=e^{f(x)} \,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\, \dfrac{dy}{dx} = f'(x) e^{f(x)}$
$y=\ln f(x) \,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\, \dfrac{dy}{dx} = \dfrac{f'(x)}{f(x)}$
$y=a^{f(x)} \,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\, \dfrac{dy}{dx} = (\ln a)f'(x)a^{f(x)}$
$y=log _{a} f(x) \,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\, \dfrac{dy}{dx} = \dfrac{f'(x)}{(\ln a) f(x)}$

Applications of Differentiation #


Integral Calculus #



Formulas #


$ {\Large\int} f'(x)[f(x)]^n dx = \dfrac{1}{n+1}[f(x)]^{n+1} + c $ $ \text{ where } n \neq -1 $
$ {\Large\int_{a}^{b}} f(x) dx \approx \dfrac{b-a} {2n} {\Large\{} f(a) + f(b) + 2 {\Large[} f(x_1)+...+f(x_{n-1}){\Large ]} {\Large\}}$ $ \text { where } a=x_0 \text{ and } b=x_n $
$ {\Large\int} f'(x)\cos f(x)dx = \sin f(x) + c$
$ {\Large\int} f'(x)\sin f(x)dx = -\cos f(x) + c$
$ {\Large\int} f'(x)\sec^2 f(x)dx = \tan f(x) + c$
$ {\Large\int} f'(x)e^{f(x)}dx = e^{f(x)} + c$
$ {\Large\int} \dfrac{f'(x)}{f(x)}dx = \ln|f(x)| + c$
$ {\Large\int} f'(x)a^{f(x)}dx = \dfrac{a^f(x)}{\ln a} +c$
$ {\Large\int} \dfrac{f'(x)}{(\ln a) f(x)} = \log_{a} |f(x)| + c$
$ {\Large\int}_b^a f(x)dx = F(b)-F(a) \text{, where F(x) is the anti-derivative of f(x)}$
$F'(x) = \dfrac{d}{dx} {\Large\int}_a^x f(t)dt = f(x) \text{ (the Fundamental Therom of Calculus)}$
Items on formula sheet are highlighted
$ {\Large\int} f'(x)[f(x)]^n dx = \dfrac{1}{n+1}[f(x)]^{n+1} + c $ $ \text{ where } n \neq -1 $
$ {\Large\int_{a}^{b}} f(x) dx \approx \dfrac{b-a} {2n} {\Large\{} f(a) + f(b) + 2 {\Large[} f(x_1)+...+f(x_{n-1}){\Large ]} {\Large\}}$ $ \text { where } a=x_0 \text{ and } b=x_n $
$ {\Large\int} f'(x)\cos f(x)dx = \sin f(x) + c$
$ {\Large\int} f'(x)\sin f(x)dx = -\cos f(x) + c$
$ {\Large\int} f'(x)\sec^2 f(x)dx = \tan f(x) + c$
$ {\Large\int} f'(x)e^{f(x)}dx = e^{f(x)} + c$
$ {\Large\int} \dfrac{f'(x)}{f(x)}dx = \ln|f(x)| + c$
$ {\Large\int} f'(x)a^{f(x)}dx = \dfrac{a^f(x)}{\ln a} +c$
$ {\Large\int} \dfrac{f'(x)}{(\ln a) f(x)} = \log_{a} |f(x)| + c$
$ {\Large\int}_b^a f(x)dx = F(b)-F(a) \text{, where F(x) is the anti-derivative of f(x)}$
$F'(x) = \dfrac{d}{dx} {\Large\int}_a^x f(t)dt = f(x) \text{ (the Fundamental Therom of Calculus)}$

$y=\sin^{-1}f(x) \,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\, \dfrac{dy}{dx} = \dfrac{f'(x)} {\sqrt {1 - (f(x))^2} }$
$ {\Large\int} \dfrac{f'(x)} {\sqrt {1 - (f(x))^2} } dx = \sin^{-1} f(x) + c$
$ y = \sin^{-1} \dfrac{f(x)}{a} \,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\, \dfrac{dy}{dx} = \dfrac{f'(x)}{\sqrt{a^2 - (f(x))^2}} $
$ {\Large\int} \dfrac{f'(x)} {\sqrt {a^2 - (f(x))^2} } dx = \sin^{-1} \dfrac{f(x)}{a} + c$
$y=\cos^{-1}f(x) \,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\, \dfrac{dy}{dx} = - \dfrac{f'(x)} {\sqrt {1 - (f(x))^2} }$
$ {\Large\int} - \dfrac{f'(x)} {\sqrt {1 - (f(x))^2} } = \cos^{-1}f(x) + c \text{ or } -\sin^{-1}f(x) +c$ $ \text{Note the constant c will have different values with these two options} $
$y=\cos^{-1} \dfrac{f(x)}{a} \,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\, \dfrac{dy}{dx} = - \dfrac{f'(x)} {\sqrt {a^2 - (f(x))^2} }$
$ {\Large\int} - \dfrac{f'(x)} {\sqrt {a^2 - (f(x))^2} } = \cos^{-1}\dfrac{f(x)}{a} + c \text{ or } -\sin^{-1}\dfrac{f(x)}{a} +c$ $ \text{Note the constant c will have different values with these two options} $
$y=\tan^{-1}f(x) \,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\, \dfrac{dy}{dx} = \dfrac{f'(x)} {1 + (f(x))^2}$
$ {\Large\int} \dfrac{f'(x)} {1 + (f(x))^2} dx = \ \tan^{-1} f(x) + c$
$y=\tan^{-1}\dfrac{f(x)}{a} \,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\, \dfrac{dy}{dx} = \dfrac{1}{a} \tan^{-1} \dfrac{f(x)}{a} $
$ {\Large\int} \dfrac{f'(x)} {a^2 + (f(x))^2} dx = \dfrac{1}{a} \tan^{-1} \dfrac{f(x)}{a} + c$
$ \text{Function and its inverse} \,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\, \dfrac{dy}{dx} \times \dfrac{dx}{dy} = 1, \text{ or } \dfrac{dy}{dx} = \dfrac{1}{\dfrac{dx}{dy}} $
$\sin^2nx = \dfrac{1}{2}(1-\cos 2nx)$
$\cos^2nx = \dfrac{1}{2}(1+\cos 2nx)$

Applications of Calculus #



Formulas #


Volumes formed by rotation about the x-axis = $V=\pi \int_a^b y^2 dx$
Volumes formed by rotation about the y-axis = $V=\pi \int_a^b x^2 dy$
Logistic equation option 1: $\frac{dP}{dt} = kP(N-P)$

Logistic equation option 2:$\frac{dP}{dt} = kP(1-\frac{P}{N})$

Probability and Discrete Probability Distributions #



Formulas #


$ P(E) = \dfrac{n(E)}{n(S)} $
$P(A \cup B) = P(A) + P(B) - P(A \cap B) $
$P(A \cap B) = P(A)P(B)$
$P(\overline{E}) = 1 - P(E)$
$ P(A|B) = \dfrac{P(A \cap B)}{P(B)} \text{, where } P(B) \neq 0 $
$ P(X=x) = \dfrac{1}{n} \text {applies only to uniform proability distributions with n values} $
$ E(X) =\sum xp(x)$
$ E(X) = \mu $
$ \sigma^{2} = Var(X) = \sum(x-\mu)^{2}p(x)$
$ Var(X) = E[(x-\mu)^2]$
$ Var(X) = \sum[x^2p(x)] - \mu^2$
$ Var(X) = E(X^2) - \mu^2$
$ \sigma = \sqrt{Var(X)}$

Descriptive Statistics and Bivariate Data Analysis #



Formulas #


$ \text{Mean} = \dfrac{\text{Sum of scores}}{\text{Total number of scores}} = \overline{x} = \dfrac{\sum{x}}{n} $
$ \text{The median of n scores is the } \dfrac{n+1}{2} \text{th score} $ $ \text{if n is even the median is the average of the two middle scores to the left and the right of } \dfrac{n+1}{2} $
$ \text{Range = highest score - lowest score} $
$ \text{Interquartile range = Q3 - Q1} $
$\text{An outlier is a score with} $ $ \text { less than } Q1 - 1.5 \times IQR $ $ \text { or more than than } Q3 + 1.5 \times IQR $
$ \overline{x} = \dfrac{\sum fx}{\sum f} $

Random Variables #



Formulas #


$P(a < X < b) = P(a \leq X \leq b) \text {(for continuous probability distributions})$
$F(x) = P(X\leq x) = {\Large\int}^x_a f(x)dx \text { (for continuous probability distributions, where f(x) is a probability distribution function defined in the domain [a,b] and F(x) is the cumulative density function})$
$P(X \leq r) = {\Large\int}_a^r f(x)dx$
$P(a \leq X \leq b) = {\Large\int}_a^b f(x)dx$
$f(x) = \dfrac{1}{b-a} \text{ for } a \leq x \leq b \text { (Uniform continuous probability distributions, where f(x) is a probability distribution function defined in the domain [a,b]})$
$z = \dfrac{x-\mu}{\sigma} $

The Binomial Distribution #



Formulas #


$ \text{Bernoulli distribution: } E(X) = p $
$ \text{Bernoulli distribution: } VAR(X) = p(1-p) $
$\text{Binomial distribution}: P(X=r) = ^nC_rp^r(1-p)^{n-r}$
$\text{Binomial distribution}: X\sim Bin(n,p) $ $ \Rightarrow P(X=x) $ $ = \bigl({n \atop x} \bigr)p^x(1-p)^{n-x}, x=0,1,...,n$
$ \text{binomial distribution: } E(X) = np $
$ \text{binmomial distribution: } VAR(X) = np(1-p) $
$ \hat{p} = \dfrac{x}{n} $
$ \text{sample proportions: } E(\hat{p}) = p $
$ \text{sample proportions: } \text{VAR} (\hat{p}) = \dfrac{p(1-p)}{n} $

$ \text{binmomial distribution: } VAR(X) = np(1-p) $
$ \hat{p} = \dfrac{x}{n} $
$ \text{sample proportions: } E(\hat{p}) = p $
$ \text{sample proportions: } \text{VAR} (\hat{p}) = \dfrac{p(1-p)}{n} $

Working with Combinatorics #



Formulas #


$P(E) = \dfrac{\text{Number of ways an event can occur}}{\text{Total number of possible outcomes}}$
$^n P_r = \dfrac{n!}{(n-r)!}$
$0! = 1$
$^n P_n = n!$
$^n P_0 = 1$
Permutations with repeated objects: $\dfrac{n!}{a!b!c!}$ where $a+b+c+... \leq n$
$^nC_r = \dfrac{^n P_r}{r!}$
$(^n_r) = ^n C _r = \dfrac{n!}{r!(n-r)!}$
$ ^n C _0 = (^n_0) = 1 $
$ ^n C _n = (^n_n) = 1 $
$ ^n C _r = ^nC_{n-r} $
$ (x+a)^n = x^n + (^n_1)x^{n-1}a+...+(^n_r)x^{n-r}a^r+...a^n $
$ (x+a)^n = (^n_0)x^n + (^n_1)x^{n-1}a + (^n_2)x^{n-2}a^2 + (^n_3)x^{n-3}a^3+...+(^n_k)x^{n-k}a^k+...+(^n_n)a^n $
$ ^n C _k = ^{n-1}C_{k-1} + ^{n-1}C_k $
